intro: Burmeistera orientalis, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its foliage is usually broad and lance-shaped, with a glossy texture. Burmeistera orientalis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
